intro: Thalictrum × timeroyi nothosubsp. timeroyi, commonly known as the hybrid meadow rue, is a perennial plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. It is native to the mountainous regions of East Asia, including parts of China and Japan. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
